DataElement.preferredName: ALL Transplantation Time Cytogenetic Analysis Complete Remission Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indicator that describes whether or not acute lymphoblastic leukemia was in cytogenetic remission at the time of transplantation.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: ALL Transplantation Time Cytogenetic Analysis Complete Remission
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Leukemia with an acute onset, characterized by the presence of lymphoblasts in the bone marrow and the peripheral blood.  It includes the precursor B lymphoblastic leukemia and precursor T lymphoblastic leukemia._The grafting of tissues from one individual to another or place to place within a single individual._The continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past._Techniques for analysis of chromosomal and subchromosomal properties and structures, such as those to diagnose, classify, screen for, or manage genetic diseases and abnormalities._The disappearance of all signs of cancer in response to treatment.  This does not always mean the cancer has been cured.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A leukemia with an acute onset, characterized by the presence of lymphoblasts or Burkitt cells in the bone marrow and the peripheral blood.  It includes the precursor B lymphoblastic leukemia, precursor T lymphoblastic leukemia, and Burkitt's leukemia.

Concepts.definition: Leukemia with an acute onset, characterized by the presence of lymphoblasts in the bone marrow and the peripheral blood. It includes the acute B lymphoblastic leukemia and acute T lymphoblastic leukemia.

Property.preferredDefinition: The grafting of tissues from one individual to another or place to place within a single individual.:the continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.:Techniques for analysis of chromosomal and subchromosomal properties and structures, such as those to diagnose, classify, screen for, or manage genetic diseases and abnormalities.:The disappearance of all signs of cancer in response to treatment.  This does not always mean the cancer has been cured.

Concepts.definition: Transference of a tissue or organ within an individual, between individuals of the same species, or between individuals of different species.
The continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.
Techniques for analysis of chromosomal and subchromosomal properties and structures, such as those to diagnose, classify, screen for, or manage genetic diseases and abnormalities.
The disappearance of all signs of cancer in response to treatment.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.
